channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Ukraine crisis: World leaders step up talks amid invasion fears
item.description: Talks begin in Moscow between the French and Russian leaders amid fears Russia could invade Ukraine.

item.title: NSO Group: Israel launches inquiry into police hacking claims
item.description: Officers allegedly used sophisticated spyware to target public figures' phones without warrants.

item.title: Canada trucker protest: Ottawa declares emergency
item.description: The Canadian capital's mayor says the city is out of control, with more protesters than police.

item.title: Peng Shuai: Weibo post sparked 'huge misunderstanding'
item.description: The Chinese tennis star again urges fans not to worry about her in an interview with Western media.

item.title: Rayan: Morocco holds funeral for five-year-old who died trapped in well
item.description: Five-year-old Rayan Oram died despite a painstaking rescue effort to free him at the weekend.

item.title: Paralysed man with severed spine walks thanks to implant
item.description: World first using electrical implant developed by a team of Swiss researchers

item.title: China's Tencent restores Fight Club ending after backlash
item.description: In a rare reversal, Chinese streaming giant Tencent undid massive cuts it had made to the original.

item.title: Covid: Australia to reopen borders to international travel
item.description: Tourists and other visa holders can enter from 21 February for the first time in almost two years.

item.title: Climate change: Top companies exaggerating their progress - study
item.description: Companies including Google, Amazon and Ikea are not meeting their own green targets, a report finds.

item.title: Kush: Sierra Leone's new illegal drug
item.description: With Kush use spreading rapidly, local film-maker Tyson Conteh asks whether Sierra Leone can stop the march of this dangerously addictive high.

item.title: Austria on high alert after series of deadly avalanches
item.description: Nine people are killed after more than 100 avalanches hit ski fields, with warnings of more to come.

item.title: Western Australia bushfires threaten lives after record summer heat
item.description: Amid catastrophic conditions, fires have destroyed homes and scorched 60,000 hectares of land.

item.title: Lata Mangeshkar: 'Why I loved the Indian singer as much as The Beatles'
item.description: For many South Asians around the world, Bollywood singer Lata Mangeshkar's legacy goes beyond singing.

item.title: Eileen Gu: US-China tension is trickiest slope for Olympic free skier
item.description: The US-born athlete representing China is provoking as much talk about her politics as her prodigious skiing.

item.title: Tonga: How an Internet blackout left many desperate for money
item.description: The breakdown cut off a vital source of funds to Tongans at a time when they needed it most.

item.title: Nigeria's renters may no longer have to pay a year in advance
item.description: Nigerian landlords have long demanded a year's rent upfront - up to $20,000 - but that might soon change.

item.title: Israel's Mossad suspected of high-level Iran penetration
item.description: The spy agency is said to have worked its way high up into Iran's security services.

item.title: Ukraine conflict: Valery, young victim of a frozen war
item.description: While Nato warns of a possible Russian invasion, 65 Ukrainian soldiers have died in the past year.

item.title: School reopening: The Indian children who have never seen a classroom
item.description: Experts say Covid-19 lockdowns have taken away precious years of learning from children.

item.title: Sudan's feared secret police make a comeback
item.description: Amira Osman is one of dozens believed to have been arrested by Sudan's feared secret police.

item.title: Ukraine crisis: 'It’s like they stuck a knife in our back'
item.description: Ukraine has been living with war for the past eight years, and people in Dnipro are dealing with past scars and the threat of more to come.

item.title: Cyclone Batsirai: Whole villages swept away in Madagascar
item.description: At least 10 people have been killed and nearly 50,000 displaced after Cyclone Batsirai tore through Madagascar.

item.title: Lata Mangeshkar: India bids farewell to beloved singer
item.description: Large crowds in Mumbai, India, pay their respects after the legendary singer's death at the age of 92.

item.title: Lata Mangeshkar: A look back at the life of India's nightingale
item.description: Singer Lata Mangeshkar's voice is the soundtrack to more than a thousand Bollywood films.

item.title: Moment bridge in Germany is blown up for safety reasons
item.description: Watch a controlled explosion destroy this bridge in Germany in a matter of seconds.
